page.title: 06Dunkery Beacon
page.content: Dunkery Beacon is Exmoor's highest point which is 1,705 feet above sea level.Dunkery Beacon has magnificent distant views with a range of up to 150 miles from the Malverns to Brown Willy.You can only see it on a day when it is completely clear.Somebody has said that Snowdon can be seen on a very good day.Many people visit the summit to look at the views and often come back again.When they come back the people look at the beautiful scenery around.The cairn on the summit is modern and the memorial stone set in its side commemorates the gift of Dunkery to the National Trust by Sir Thomas Acland Bt.Colonel Wiggin and Allan Hugher Esq.The summit mound on which the cairn stands is not known to have any significance.
